title: 112_hr2512
content: The Act is titled the "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" and includes definitions for clarity. The Act titled "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines key terms such as hazardous substance, pollutant or contaminant, release, remedy, response, Henderson Redevelopment Agency, and Secretary. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the term "State" refers to the State of Nevada. The "Three Kids Mine Federal Land" consists of approximately 948 acres of Federal land in Nevada, while the "Three Kids Mine Project Site" includes the Federal land and adjacent non-Federal land totaling approximately 1,262 acres. SEC. 3. LAND CONVEYANCE. The Secretary shall convey to the Henderson Redevelopment Agency all right, title, and interest of the United States in the Three Kids Mine Federal Land, subject to valid existing rights. The fair market value of the land will be adjusted by deducting assessment, remediation, and reclamation costs for the Three Kids Mine Project Area. The Secretary will appraise the Three Kids Mine Federal Land within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The appraisal will determine the fair market value without considering past contamination, following national standards. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will reimburse appraisal costs. The Secretary will estimate the costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site based on a Phase II environmental site assessment approved by the State and conducted in accordance with ASTM standards. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency and the State for the Three Kids Mine Project Site assessment. In case of disagreement, experts will be jointly selected to advise on determining costs. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will pay fair market value for mine remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site, as outlined in the Mine Remediation and Reclamation Agreement executed by the State. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must notify the Secretary in writing within 90 days of the Mine Remediation and Reclamation Agreement execution to accept conveyance of the Three Kids Mine Federal Land. SEC. 4. WITHDRAWAL. The Three Kids Mine Federal Land is withdrawn from various activities for a 10-year period, including entry, operation, and disposal under public land laws, as well as mining and mineral leasing laws. Any existing withdrawal for reclamation projects involving this land is relinquished if the Bureau of Reclamation no longer requires it. The Three Kids Mine Federal Land is withdrawn for 10 years, excluding land no longer needed. Existing water infrastructure on the land is protected for operation and maintenance. SEC. 5. ACEC BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern is adjusted per the map dated February 6, 2012. SEC. 6. RELEASE OF THE UNITED STATES. Upon conveyance under section 3, the United States is released from liabilities related to hazardous substances at the Three Kids Mine Project Site. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT does not apply to land conveyed under this Act. Passed the House of Representatives on June 5, 2012, attested by Karen L. Haas, Clerk.
